page.title: 06Bardon Hill
page.content: { Bardon Hill}is the{highest}point in {Leicestershire}with a height of 278 metres.On the top is a trig point and a mast used by the Quarry for personal radio contact.The {Electricity and Gas {Boards}also have equipment there.From the top of the hill you can see all the activity in the quarry below.There is a magnificent{view}and on a clear day it is possible to see Boston Stump There is the ruin of a brick shelter which was built for{Queen Victoria when she picnicked on Bardon Hill. The{stone}of Bardon Hill is{volcanic. There is a geological fault, called the{Thringstone Fault},which starts in Derbyshire,runs through the quarry and on into Germany. The area is dominated by the quarry, which covers an area of 360 acres and is 107 metres deep.Much of the hill has been removed by quarrying.
